backup.title: Babes-kopia
backup.app_instances_not_backed_up_description: {numInstances} app instance has no backup configured | {numInstances} app instances have no backup configured

backup.i_have_stored_encryption_password: I have stored the password in a safe place
backup.retention_tooltip: Number of backup snapshots stored before automatic deletion
backup.cluster_backup_password_warning_descript: The configuration cluster backup contains sensitive data required for a disaster recovery.
backup.cluster_configuration_tooltip: Download an encrypted GPG file that you can use to restore the cluster in a disaster recovery scenario. Additionally, the cluster configuration is automatically backed up to a repository during each scheduled run.
backup.restore_tooltip: You can restore any previously backed up app or the whole cluster:
backup.backup_page_tooltip_2: Cluster data is composed of cluster configuration data and apps data.
backup.repositories_tooltip: These are the repositories where your apps are backed up to
backup.select_restore_node: Select the node where the instance will be restored
backup.delete_backup_explanation_2: Existing backed up data will be left intact on the original repository.
backup.backup_page_tooltip_8: Diaster recovery: you will need a cluster configuration backup and a fresh installation of {productName}. The disaster recovery can be achieved only from the cluster configuration wizard.
backup.name: Name
backup.backup_repository_exists: URL hau duen biltegi bat badago jada
backup.repo_password_tooltip: This password is used to encrypt data in the repository. Store this password in a safe place, otherwise you won't be able to restore your backed up data
backup.type_repo_password_to_confirm: Type repository password to confirm deletion
backup.cluster_backup_password_warning_descript: Set a strong encryption password, then download the backup and keep it in a safe place.
backup.minutes_past_the_hour: Every hour, {minutes} minute past the hour | Every hour, {minutes} minutes past the hour
backup.cluster_backup_password_warning: You must set the encryption password
backup.repository_password_helper: Enter password if repository was configured previously
backup.cluster_backup_password_info_description:
Enter a password to encrypt the backup.
For security reasons do not use your current password.
Make sure to remember it, you will need it in case of disaster recovery.

backup.no_instance_to_restore_description: It looks like there is no app instance backed up on your repositories

backup.disabled_backups_description: There is {num} backup disabled | There are {num} backups disabled
backup.delete_repo_explanation_2: Ensure you have stored repository password in a safe place, or you won't be able to restore your backup data from the original repository.
backup.backup_page_tooltip_manual: For more information go to the Backup and restore manual page.
backup.smb_url_tooltip: It is possible to specify a share subfolder path using the "/" slash separator

system_logs.title: System logs

loki.no_logs: This instance does not contains any log
loki.title: Loki
loki.tooltip: Cluster nodes transmit their log streams to the active Loki instance, which operates on the leader node. When a leader node is replaced, the previous leader node retains its inactive Loki instance, allowing the System logs page to search through it until it is uninstalled.
loki.uninstall_description: Uninstall {instance}? Logs stored inside this instance will be deleted too. This action is NOT reversible.

system_logs.loki_tooltip: Search logs from the active Loki instance, from a former leader node or from a Loki backup.
system_logs.loki_instance_description: Logs are stored in more than one Loki instance. Choose one in the field below.
